Use your iPhone SIM card in your 3G iPad

06 May 2010 . . Comments #3g #Chop #featured #Handy Guide #Ipad #Iphone #Iphone Sim Card #Micro Sim #O2 #O2 Ireland #Vodafone

Don’t want to shell out another 20-30 Euros per month on another data plan for your new 3G iPad? Read on…

You can simply chop the plastic off from around your existing iPhone SIM using this [handy guide][1]. This will turn it into a Micro-SIM (the format required for the 3G iPad). This way, with the aid of a Eur6 [Micro-Sim adapter][2], you can easily switch the SIM from your iPhone into your 3G iPad whenever you need it.

The first time you insert it into the iPad, just use the same APN settings on your iPad as your iPhone and data should be ready to go!

Just make sure you don’t go over your monthly data usage limit. So far, I’ve successfully carried out the operation on an O2 Ireland SIM and a 3 Ireland SIM.

[1]: http://www.macnotes.net/files/2010/06/micro-sim-stencil-ipad3g-iphone4.pdf [2]: http://microsim-shop.com/
